news_header: US government debt interest rates are rising amid concerns over tariffs and inflation.
news_original_title: Ursula von der Leyeniltä tiukka vastaus Trumpille – Markkinakorot nousussa
news_text: On Tuesday afternoon, long-term US government debt interest rates rose as President Jerome Powell is set to address the Senate regarding the US economy. President Trump signed an order imposing 25% import duties on steel and aluminum, raising fears among investors that these tariffs could accelerate inflation and influence Powell's interest rate policy. Ursula von der Leyen warned that unjustified tariffs on the EU would provoke strict countermeasures. The interest rate on a 10-year US loan rose to 4.531%, while the two-year loan rate increased to 4.287%. Investors are also closely watching upcoming US inflation figures, with predictions of 2.9% inflation for January. Meanwhile, the euro strengthened against other currencies.
